text: The 2002 Paris–Roubaix was the 100th running of the Paris–Roubaix single-day cycling race, often known as the Hell of the North. It was held on 14 April 2002 over a distance of . These are the results for the 2002 edition of the Paris–Roubaix cycling classic, in which Johan Museeuw entered history by winning his third Paris–Roubaix after an impressive attack 40 kilometres from the Velodrome of Roubaix. This edition was run under wind and rain conditions. ==Results== 14-04-2002: Compiègne–Roubaix, 261 km. {| class="wikitable" style="width:45em;margin-bottom:0;" |+ Results (1–10) |- ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- !style="text-align:center"| 1 | | |align=right| 6h 39' 08" |- !style="text-align:center"| 2 | | |align=right| + 3' 04" |- !style="text- align:center"| 3 | | |align=right| + 3' 08" |- !style="text-align:center"| 4 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text-align:center"| 5 | |Team Coast |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text-align:center"| 6 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text-align:center"| 7 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text-align:center"| 8 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text- align:center"| 9 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |- !style="text-align:center"| 10 | | |align=right| + 4' 02" |} ==References== ==External links== *Race website 2002 Category:2002 in road cycling Category:2002 in French sport Paris-Roubaix Category:April 2002 sports events in Europe
